Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery plate; very worn off-white slip. On top of rim, broken maeander band between lines; at outer edge of floor black band with added red and white lines; on floor, lotus flower and three tongues preserved; on edge of rim, traces of short black vertical bands; underside reserved with three close-set bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1036)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 81-2, Nau 18, pl. 4e)
